title: Update theme from green to navy blue

requirements.summary: Replace green-based global theme tokens and custom green styles with a navy-blue palette for light and dark modes.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/index.css, CSS variables that currently produce a green primary theme (e.g., --primary, --ring, --sidebar-primary and related foreground/accent variables as appropriate) are updated to a navy-blue palette for both :root and .dark.
Any custom CSS using the previous green color (e.g., .logo-text gradient and .company-name-outline stroke/shadow) is updated to match the navy-blue theme.
Primary buttons/links/focus rings and sidebar highlights render in navy blue throughout the app without introducing unreadable contrast in light or dark mode.

file_operations.description: Update the global OKLCH theme variables to a navy-blue hue across both :root and .dark (including --primary, --ring, --sidebar-primary, and related background/foreground/secondary/muted/sidebar tokens that currently use the green hue), and replace custom green styles (.logo-text gradient and .company-name-outline stroke/shadow) with navy-blue equivalents while preserving readable contrast.

requirements.summary: Align PWA/browser theme metadata colors with the new navy blue brand color.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html meta name="theme-color" and msapplication-TileColor are updated from the current blue value to the chosen navy blue hex value.
frontend/public/manifest.json theme_color is updated from the current value to the same navy blue hex value used in index.html.
After the change, the browser UI/PWA theme color reflects navy blue when the app is loaded/installed.

file_operations.description: Change the meta theme color metadata to match the chosen navy blue hex value (update both meta name="theme-color" and meta name="msapplication-TileColor" to the same navy color).
Update manifest.json theme_color to the same navy blue hex value used in frontend/index.html so installed PWA and browser UI reflect navy blue.
